pageContext.claim: “We are on track to APPREHEND more than one million people coming across the Southern Border this year. Great job by Border Patrol (and others) who are working in a Broken System. Can be fixed by Congress so easily and quickly if only the Democrats would get on board!”
pageContext.analysis: In the first five months of Fiscal Year 2019, Customs and Border Protection reported 268,044 apprehensions along the southern border. That means on average, they apprehended about 54,000 people, putting CBP on track to apprehend about 643,000 people if the trend continues, not 1 million.
